xwikidoc.name: Translations
xwikidoc.creator: xwiki:XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.author: xwiki:XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.title: Translations
xwikidoc.content:
admin.activeDirectory.info=In order to configure and start using Active Directory in XWiki, please make sure that you understand how Windows Active Directory works and how to get data from it. Otherwise, call for help from a system administrator. \nThe configuration is initialized with some default values that work in general. However, small adjustments are needed to be done depending on each server configuration in order to get the right matching. admin.activeDirectoryConnection=Connection Settings admin.activeDirectoryConfiguration=Configuration admin.activeDirectoryConfigurationAdvanced=Advanced admin.activeDirectoryConfigurationAdvanced.show=Show Advanced Configuration admin.activeDirectoryConfigurationAdvanced.hide=Hide Advanced Configuration admin.activeDirectoryMiscellaneous=Miscellaneous admin.activeDirectoryMiscellaneous.hint=Force to empty the cache containing Active Directory groups. activeDirectory.error.missingLdapService=Active Directory service is not available. Please verify your installation. activeDirectory.warning.ldapAuthenticationIsNotEnabled=The system could not connect to Active Directory server because the LDAP authentication service is not enabled. Edit the ##{0}## file, add the following lines and restart the wiki: activeDirectory.warning.ldapAuthenticationIsNotSet=The ActiveDirectory Authentication Service is not currently active. To enable it, please visit the Authentication section of the Administration page. activeDirectory.default=(Default) activeDirectory.aDGroup.placehoder=Active Directory group activeDirectory.xWikiGroup.placeholder=XWiki group activeDirectory.aDUserField.placeholder=Active Directory user field activeDirectory.xWikiUserProperty.placeholder=XWiki user property activeDirectory.resetGroupCache.submit=Reset group cache activeDirectory.save.submit=Save activeDirectory.resetGroupCacheSuccess=Groups cache has been reset. activeDirectory.newEntry.title=New Entry activeDirectory.checkConnection=Check connection activeDirectory.checkConnection.error=Failed to connect to the Active Directory server! Click on this message for details and contact sales@xwiki.com. activeDirectory.checkConnection.hint=To check the connection for the current setup, the data needs to be saved first. This action will be handle by the "Check connection" button when clicked. activeDirectory.checkConnection.success=Test connection succeeded! activeDirecfory.config.initializationComment=Configuration initialized with the default values.
XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap=Enable the Active Directory authentication XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap.hint=Enable the Active Directory authentication for this wiki, otherwise only XWiki authentication will work. If enabled and configured properly, an XWiki user will be created whenever an Active Directory user visits the wiki for the first time. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_server=Active Directory server address XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_server.hint=The address (IP or domain name) of the server to connect to. For example, 127.0.0.1 would be used for a server that is located on the same machine where XWiki is installed. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_port=Active Directory server port XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_port.hint=The port to connect to. For example, 389 would be used if the server is running on the standard LDAP port. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_bind_DN=Active Directory User DN XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_bind_DN.hint=The bind login (user distinguish name) to connect to the server with. This can be left empty for anonymous access to the server. If the server is not configured to accept anonymous access, then the full DN of a user with proper access rights must be provided. For example, cn=admin,dc=example,dc=com is how a user DN should look. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_bind_pass=Active Directory password XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_bind_pass.hint=This can be left empty for anonymous access to the server. This is the password for the previous defined Active Directory User DN and should be used together. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_user_group=Allow Active Directory Authentication only to certain group XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_user_group.hint=This field can be used to provide authentication rights only to the members of an Active Directory group. If this is empty, no restriction will be applied and all the users from the Base DN will be able to authenticate. When set at subwiki level, it does not influence global users access.To configure use the full DN of the group: cn=developers,ou=groups,o=XWiki,c=FR. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_exclude_group=Forbid Active Directory Authentication to certain group XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_exclude_group.hint=This field can be used to deny authentication rights to the members of an Active Directory group. The users that are members of the following group can't authenticate. When set at subwiki level, it does not influence global users access. To configure use the full DN of the group: cn=designers,ou=groups,o=XWiki,c=FR. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_base_DN=Active Directory Base DN XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_base_DN.hint=The Base DN is the root of the tree containing the users and where the server performs the search. E.g. dc=example,dc=com. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_UID_attr=Active Directory UID attribute name XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_UID_attr.hint=Specifies the Active Directory attribute containing the identifier to be used as the XWiki user name. The default is 'sAMAccountName'. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_trylocal=Enable the XWiki authentication XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_trylocal.hint=Enable the XWiki authentication for this wiki, as a fallback solution. Without this setting you will be unable to log into XWiki with local accounts. Also, if Active Directory authentication fails for any reason, the XWiki DB authentication will be tried with the same credentials. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_update_user=Update user from Active Directory after login XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_update_user.hint=If this property is enabled, the XWiki user data will be updated from Active Directory on every login of the user, otherwise the mapping will be done only once, when the user is created. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_update_photo=Update the user photo from Active Directory XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_update_photo.hint=If this property is enabled, the XWiki avatar will be updated from Active Directory on every login of the user, otherwise the photo will not be updated. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_photo_attachment_name=Attachment name used to save the Active Directory photo XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_photo_attachment_name.hint=The Active Directory photo name that will be used in XWiki profile. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_photo_attribute=Active Directory photo attribute name XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_photo_attribute.hint=Specifies the Active Directory attribute that contains the photo image. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_fields_mapping=Active Directory user fields mapping XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_fields_mapping.hint=Set a link between an XWiki user property that needs to store the data from an Active Directory user field. For example, first_name->givenName (first_name belongs to XWiki.XWikiUsers class and givenName to Active Directory user profile) XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_group_mapping=Active Directory groups mapping XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_group_mapping.hint=Set a link between an XWiki group that needs to store, as members, ther users belonging to an Active Directory group. For example, XWiki.XWikiAdminGroup->cn=marketing,ou=groups,dc=example. By default, all the users are added into XWiki.XWikiAllGroup. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_groupcache_expiration=Active Directory groups cache expiration XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_groupcache_expiration.hint=Time in seconds after which the list of members in a group is refreshed from Active Directory. The default is 21600 (6 hours). XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_mode_group_sync=When to synchronize the Active Directory groups XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_mode_group_sync.hint=The groups will be synchronized by default on every authentication of a user. For example, if an Active Directory user is moved to a different group, at the next login it will be moved in XWiki in the right group. XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_mode_group_sync_always=At each authentication of a user XWiki.XWikiPreferences_ldap_mode_group_sync_create=Upon creation of a user
ActiveDirectory.Code.ActiveDirectoryConfigClass_ldap_ssl=Enable SSL connection to Active Directory server ActiveDirectory.Code.ActiveDirectoryConfigClass_ldap_ssl.hint=This is an optional configuration. Use it only if the Active Directory server is configured to support LDAP over SSL. ActiveDirectory.Code.ActiveDirectoryConfigClass_ldap_ssl.keystore=Path to SSL keystore ActiveDirectory.Code.ActiveDirectoryConfigClass_ldap_ssl.keystore.hint=Path to the keystore file to use in SSL connection. Check the documentation for additional information. ActiveDirectory.Code.ActiveDirectoryConfigClass_ldap_ssl.secure_provider=SSL secure provider ActiveDirectory.Code.ActiveDirectoryConfigClass_ldap_ssl.secure_provider.hint=A java secure provider to be used in SSL connection, besides the already preregistered ones.
security.authservice.service.activedirectory.name=Active Directory Authenticator security.authservice.service.activedirectory.description=Authenticate using the configured Active Directory server
## FREE LICENSE admin.activedirectory=Active Directory admin.activedirectory.description=Configuration options to authenticate users against an Active Directory server. activeDirectory.extension.name=Active Directory Application (Pro)
